fr.lipn.nlptools.utils.externprog
Class BroadcastReaderConsumer

java.lang.Object
  fr.lipn.nlptools.utils.externprog.BroadcastReaderConsumer
All Implemented Interfaces:
ReaderConsumer
public class BroadcastReaderConsumer
extends java.lang.Object
implements ReaderConsumer

This class is a BroadcastReaderConsumer.RunnableReaderConsumer multiplier: it is a ReaderConsumer which sends the data it reads to several other ReaderConsumer objects. Since a ReaderConsumer is an object which reads the data on a Reader object, it can be used to send textual data read from a stream to multiple receivers. The classical example of such a behaviour is the standard "tee" program, which reads data on stdin and writes it both to stdout and to a file.
It is intended to make an ExternalProgram output available to several components (e.g. some parser object and a file writer), but can easily be used in a different context.
The main interest in such an object is the fact that it uses concurrency to avoid storing the whole data in memory/file: the source reader data is bufferised and all child readers threads have to read the whole buffer before loading new data from the source reader.

Author:
moreau

Constructor Detail

BroadcastReaderConsumer

public BroadcastReaderConsumer(ReaderConsumer[] receiverReaderConsumers,
                               int bufferSize,
                               org.apache.uima.util.Logger log)
Main constructor, initializes the threads.

Parameters:
receiverReaderConsumers - the set of BroadcastReaderConsumer.RunnableReaderConsumer objects to which data will be sent.
bufferSize - buffer size: it is an important parameter because all child readers must "consume" it before it is re-filled.
log - a logger object, may be null (no logging).

protected void fillBuffer(java.io.Reader reader)
                   throws ExternalProgramException
When the buffer is ready to be written (all readers have read its content), reads the source reader and writes the data into the buffer

Throws:

allReadersDone

protected boolean allReadersDone()
Returns:
true if all readers have totally read the current buffer content

receiveInterrupt

protected void receiveInterrupt(int id,
                                java.lang.Exception e)
Called by a reader receiving an exception: if it is the first one received, the exception is stored and all threads will be interrupted, including main thread Notice that the main (writer) thread has id -1 when calling this method.

Parameters:
id - the reader id
e - the exception received
